what: Welcome to the Interstroke R Package
title: interstroke_forest_plot
text: Let’s start exploring. first thing call interstroke library.
code: library(interstroke)

what: Create standard deviation data from continous variable
title: interstroke_forest_plot
text: Forest plots can compare odds ratio 1 standard deviation increase. create standard deviation variable, create new column interstroke_data dataframe similar following:
code: ## Using whr, create a whr_z by subtracting the mean from each value and dividing by the standard deviation interstroke_bmi$whr_z <- (interstroke_bmi$whr - mean(interstroke_bmi$whr, na.rm = TRUE)) /    sd(interstroke_bmi$whr, na.rm = TRUE)

title: interstroke_forest_plot
text: is_figure_stratified_subgroups creates odds ratio forest plot comparing estimates CI’s subgroups. Estimates CI’s plot log odds x-axis. y-axis split subgroups. function requires three arguments. first argument (interstroke_data) dataframe containing required variables. Second argument (subgroups) collection categorical variables display along y-axis. Format = c(“subgroup_level1”, “subgroup_level2”…) third argument (model) contains model fitted. fourth argument (regression_type) accepts either “unconditional” “conditional”. using “conditional”, model formulas must end +strata(caseid). Optional arguments may provided following: include_overall: Overall analysis included default can disabled supplying “include_overall = FALSE” argument. p_sig: default, p values 1 displayed. Assign p_sig value choosing display p values significant level. limits: Set plot axis limits format limits = c(0,10) breaks: Manually assign axis tick breaks. format: breaks = seq(0, 100, = 20) long_title: Default TRUE, print descriptive title. Set FALSE display just predictor title. text_size: Assign text size. Default text_size = 4. Example 1: Unconditional  Example 2: overall predictor title.  Example 3: Conditional variant example 2. Change regression type “conditional” append strata(caseid) end model.
code: is_figure_stratified_subgroups(interstroke_data = interstroke_pollution,                                         subgroups = c("esex","smoking","antihypertpre","cardiacrfcat"),                                         model = case_num~sysbp,                                         regression_type = "unconditional") is_figure_stratified_subgroups(interstroke_data = interstroke_bmi,                                            subgroups = c("esex","smoking","alcohfreqcat","antihypertpre","cardiacrfcat"),                                            model = case_num~whr_z,                                            regression_type = "unconditional",                                            include_overall = FALSE,                                            long_title = FALSE) is_figure_stratified_subgroups(interstroke_data = interstroke_bmi,                                            subgroups = c("esex","smoking","alcohfreqcat","antihypertpre","cardiacrfcat"),                                            model = case_num~whr_z+strata(caseid),                                            regression_type = "conditional",                                            include_overall = FALSE,                                            long_title = FALSE)

title: interstroke_forest_plot
text: R Studio click, Knit Word.

what: Welcome to the Interstroke R Package
title: interstroke_model_figure
text: Let’s start exploring. first thing call interstroke library.
code: library(interstroke)

title: interstroke_model_figure
text: model pointrange figure creates plot comparing estimates CI’s multiple models. Estimates CI’s plot log y-axis. x-axis groups models based source data grouping (quartile, quintile, etc). function requires three arguments. first argument (interstroke_data) dataframe containing required variables. second argument (models) contains list model formulas compared. third agrumgent (regression_type) accepts either “unconditional” “conditional”. using “conditional”, model formulas must end +strata(caseid). Example 1: ’ll look quintiles bmi unconditional model estimates. Comparing base fit adjusted age sex fit.  Example 2: Conditional regression can carried changing regression_type parameter “conditional”. requires model end strata(caseid). Example 3: Reference groups analysis appear first follow levels defined DATASET script.
code: is_figure_models(interstroke_data=interstroke_bmi,                   models=c(case_num~bmi_quintiles,case_num~bmi_quintiles+eage+esex),                  regression_type = "unconditional") is_figure_models(interstroke_data=interstroke_bmi,                   models=c(case_num~bmi_quintiles+strata(caseid),case_num~bmi_quintiles+eage+esex+strata(caseid)),                  regression_type = "conditional") is_figure_models(interstroke_data=interstroke_bmi,                  models=c(case_num~smoking+strata(caseid),case_num~smoking+eage+esex+whr+strata(caseid)),                  regression_type = "conditional")

title: interstroke_model_figure
text: R Studio click, Knit Word.

what: Welcome to the Interstroke R Package
title: interstroke_mrs_figure
text: Let’s start exploring. first thing call interstroke library.
code: library(interstroke)

what: Create your Modified Rankin Scale (MRS) figure
title: interstroke_mrs_figure
text: Modified Rankin Scale figure creates horizontal stacked bar plot illustrating distribution modified rankin scale across variable. function requires least three arguments. first argument (interstroke_data) dataframe containing required variables. Second argument (x_axis_variable) categorical variable divides population groups variables level. Optional arguments may provided following: dropped_prop_levels: exclude named levels predictor variable plot, assign collection variables labels exclude “dropped_prop_levels”. e.g. dropped_prop_levels = c(“BMI <25”). na_rm: drop NA’s analysis, use na_rm logical argument, default set FALSE. text_size: Assign text size. Default text_size = 3.7. Example 1: ’ll look MRS distribution csdiffsl variable (difficulty getting sleep) using is_figure_mrs function.
code: is_figure_mrs(interstroke_sleep %>% drop_na(csdiffsl) %>% filter(case== "Case"),csdiffsl)

title: interstroke_mrs_figure
text: R Studio click, Knit Word.

what: Welcome to the Interstroke R Package
title: interstroke_proportion_figure
text: Let’s start exploring. first thing call interstroke library.
code: library(interstroke)

title: interstroke_proportion_figure
text: proportions figure creates stacked bar plot illustrating proportions predictor variable (y-axis) across collected categories (x-axis), split cases controls. function requires least three arguments. first argument (interstroke_data) dataframe containing required variables. Second argument (x_axis_variable) categorical variable split across x-axis cases controls. third argument (proportion_variable) proportional variable shows proportional split within categories cases & controls. Optional arguments may provided following: dropped_prop_levels: exclude named levels predictor variable plot, assign collection variables labels exclude “dropped_prop_levels”. e.g. dropped_prop_levels = c(“BMI <25”). na_rm: drop NA’s analysis, use na_rm logical argument, default set FALSE. text_size: Assign text size. Default text_size = 3.7. Example 1: ’ll look proportional split BMI regions using is_proportion_figure function.  Example 2: filter named predictor levels. Create collection levels exclude assigned “dropped_prop_levels”. also exclude NA values using na_rm = TRUE argument.  Example 3: ’ll look proportional split abdominal obesity (waist--hip ratio) regions.  Example 4: Example 3 exclusions dropped NA’s. Notice y-axis automatically adjust proportions low.
code: # is_figure_proportion(interstroke_data, x_axis_variable, y_axis_variable)  is_figure_proportion(interstroke_bmi, regionnn7, bmi_3_level) # Exclude BMI<25 and NA's is_figure_proportion(interstroke_bmi, regionnn7, bmi_3_level,                       dropped_prop_levels = c("BMI <25"), na_rm = TRUE) is_figure_proportion(interstroke_proxy, regionnn7, highwhr) #> Warning: Removed 1 rows containing missing values (geom_col). #Exclude NA's, Low and Moderate whr's. is_figure_proportion(interstroke_proxy, regionnn7, highwhr,                      dropped_prop_levels = c("Low", "Moderate"), na_rm = TRUE)

title: interstroke_proportion_figure
text: R Studio click, Knit Word.

what: Welcome to the Interstroke R Package
title: interstroke_subtypes_figure
text: Let’s start exploring. first thing call interstroke library.
code: library(interstroke)

what: Create your stroke type subtype pointrange figure
title: interstroke_subtypes_figure
text: subtype pointrange figure creates plot comparing estimates CI’s model across stroke types (stroke, Ischaemic ICH). Estimates CI’s plot log y-axis. x-axis groups models based stroketype. function requires three arguments. first argument (interstroke_data) dataframe containing required variables. second argument (model) model formula compared across stroke types. third argument (regression_type) accepts either “unconditional” “conditional”. using “conditional”, model formulas must end +strata(caseid). Example 1: ’ll look quintiles bmi model estimates across stroke types using unconditional regression.  Example 2: ’ll look quintiles bmi model estimates across stroke types using conditional regression (add strata(caseid) end model).  Example 3: Reference groups analysis appear first follow levels defined DATASET script.
code: is_figure_subtypes(interstroke_data=interstroke_bmi,                     model=case_num ~ bmi_quintiles,                    regression_type = "unconditional") is_figure_subtypes(interstroke_data=interstroke_bmi,                     model=case_num ~ bmi_quintiles + strata(caseid),                    regression_type = "conditional") is_figure_subtypes(interstroke_data=interstroke_bmi,                    model=case_num ~ smoking + strata(caseid),                    regression_type = "conditional")

title: interstroke_subtypes_figure
text: R Studio click, Knit Word.

what: Welcome to the Interstroke R Package
title: interstroke_table_one
text: Let’s start exploring. first thing call interstroke library.
code: library(interstroke)

what: Create your first Interstroke Table One
title: interstroke_table_one
text: “Table one’s” contain baseline values collected variables (rows) across important predictor variable. example, ’ll look baseline collected variables across different levels pollution home using is_table_one function. first argument (interstroke_data) dataframe containing required variables. second argument (model) standard R formula. left hand side ~ symbol contains predictor (placed columns table) right hand side contains baseline variables (placed rows table). Characteristic pollution N =  5024 (19%)1 mild pollution N =  7222 (27%)1 Mild pollution N =  6867 (26%)1 Moderate pollution N =  5976 (22%)1 Moderately severe pollution N =  1481 (5.5%)1 Severe pollution N =  356 (1.3%)1 p-value2 Age, yrs 63 (13) 62 (13) 62 (14) 61 (14) 62 (14) 62 (13) <0.001 Body Mass Index (kg/m2) 25.0 (4.9) 25.3 (4.6) 26.0 (4.8) 26.1 (4.8) 26.3 (4.7) 27.5 (5.4) <0.001 Systolic Blood Pressure (mmHg) 140 (21) 141 (21) 141 (22) 140 (22) 141 (22) 140 (22) 0.27 1Mean (SD) 2Kruskal-Wallis rank sum test
code: is_table_one(interstroke_data=interstroke_pollution,               model = polluteh~eage+bmi+sysbp)

title: interstroke_table_one
text: R Studio click, Knit Word.

what: Welcome to the Interstroke R Package
title: interstroke_table_two
text: Let’s start exploring. first thing call interstroke library.
code: library(interstroke)

title: interstroke_table_two
text: first argument (interstroke_data) dataframe containing required variables. second argument (models) contains list model formulas compared. third agrumgent (regression_type) accepts either “unconditional” “conditional”. using “conditional”, model formulas must end +strata(caseid). Optional arguments may provided following: table_title: Override default title custom title format: table_title = “Custom title”. Example 1: Unconditional association cookplace stroke. association cooking performed stroke Model Inside house Outside house Model 11 1.00 0.98 (0.88-1.09) 1.25 (1.15-1.37) Model 22 1.00 0.90 (0.79-1.02) 1.26 (1.14-1.40) Model 33 1.00 0.89 (0.78-1.02) 1.14 (1.02-1.27) 1Univariate (unconditional); 2Adjusted age, smoking history, total ahei score, tertile waist-hip-ratio, household income, history cardiac risk factors, systolic blood pressure (mmhg) education (unconditional); 3Adjusted age, smoking history, total ahei score, tertile waist-hip-ratio, household income, history cardiac risk factors, systolic blood pressure (mmhg), education, country income region (unconditional) Example 2: Conditional association smoking stroke. association smoking stroke Model Never Former Current 1-19 per day Model 11 1.00 1.40 (1.28-1.52) 2.54 (2.27-2.84) Model 22 1.00 1.50 (1.34-1.67) 2.44 (2.12-2.81) Model 33 1.00 1.53 (1.37-1.71) 2.45 (2.12-2.82) 1Univariate (conditional); 2Adjusted age, smoking history, total ahei score, tertile waist-hip-ratio, household income, history cardiac risk factors systolic blood pressure (mmhg) (conditional); 3Adjusted age, smoking history, total ahei score, tertile waist-hip-ratio, household income, history cardiac risk factors, systolic blood pressure (mmhg) income region (conditional)
code: is_table_two(interstroke_data=interstroke_pollution,              models=c(case_num~cookplace,case_num~cookplace+eage+nevfcur+aheiscore+whrs2tert+hhincome+cardiacrfcat+sysbp+education,                       case_num~cookplace+eage+nevfcur+aheiscore+whrs2tert+hhincome+cardiacrfcat+sysbp+education+country+incomectry),              regression_type="unconditional") is_table_two(interstroke_data=interstroke_bmi,              models=c(case_num~smoking+strata(caseid),                       case_num~smoking+eage+nevfcur+aheiscore+whrs2tert+hhincome+cardiacrfcat+sysbp+strata(caseid),                       case_num~smoking+eage+nevfcur+aheiscore+whrs2tert+hhincome+cardiacrfcat+sysbp+incomectry+strata(caseid)),              regression_type="conditional")

title: interstroke_table_two
text: R Studio click, Knit Word.

what: Welcome to the Irish Renal Registry R Package

text: Let’s start exploring. first thing call irishrenalregistry R library.
code: library(irishrenalregistry)

what: Create your first Irish Renal Registry Analysis
title: irr_table_one
text: “Table one’s” contain baseline values collected variables (rows) across important predictor variable. example, ’ll look baseline collected variables across different levels pollution home using is_table_one function. first argument (interstroke_data) dataframe containing required variables. second argument (model) standard R formula. left hand side ~ symbol contains predictor (placed columns table) right hand side contains baseline variables (placed rows table). Characteristic pollution N =  5024 (19%)1 mild pollution N =  7222 (27%)1 Mild pollution N =  6867 (26%)1 Moderate pollution N =  5976 (22%)1 Moderately severe pollution N =  1481 (5.5%)1 Severe pollution N =  356 (1.3%)1 p-value2 Age, yrs 63 (13) 62 (13) 62 (14) 61 (14) 62 (14) 62 (13) <0.001 Body Mass Index (kg/m2) 25.0 (4.9) 25.3 (4.6) 26.0 (4.8) 26.1 (4.8) 26.3 (4.7) 27.5 (5.4) <0.001 Systolic Blood Pressure (mmHg) 140 (21) 141 (21) 141 (22) 140 (22) 141 (22) 140 (22) 0.27 1Mean (SD) 2Kruskal-Wallis rank sum test
code: is_table_one(interstroke_data=interstroke_pollution,               model = polluteh~eage+bmi+sysbp)

title: Interstroke Model Figure — is_figure_models
text: interstroke_data Project specific Interstroke dataset. models list model formulas include model figure (see example) breaks axis tick mark parameters, defaults pretty_breaks. regression_type either "unconditional" "conditional". Conditional models require +strata(caseid) end model formula.

title: Interstroke stratified analysis for predictor — is_figure_stratified_subgroups
code: is_figure_stratified_subgroups(   interstroke_data,   subgroups,   model,   limits = NULL,   p_sig = NULL,   breaks = NULL,   text_size = NULL,   drop_columns = NULL,   include_overall = TRUE,   long_title = TRUE,   regression_type = NULL )

title: Interstroke stratified analysis for predictor — is_figure_stratified_subgroups
text: interstroke_data Project specific Interstroke dataset. subgroups list subgroups stratified analysis. model Model formula analysis. Predictor first independant variable. limits **Optional** Limit x axis format c(xmin, xmax). p_sig **Optional** Set level significance hide non significant values. Default displays p values <1. breaks **Optional** Set sequence breaks format seq(xmin, xmax, interval) text_size **Optional** Assign value text size. drop_columns **Optional** Drop population subgroup columns suitable joint plots. long_title **Optional** Set false just display predictor title regression_type either "unconditional" "conditional". Conditional models require +strata(caseid) end model formula.

title: Interstroke subtypes Figure — is_figure_subtypes
code: is_figure_subtypes(interstroke_data=interstroke_bmi, model=case_num ~ bmi_quintiles) #> Error in if (regression_type == "unconditional" | regression_type == "conditional") {    interstroke_modelling_data_allstroke <- is_logistic_regression(interstroke_data = !!interstroke_data_expr,         regression_type = regression_type, models = c(model)) %>%         dplyr::mutate(model = "All stroke")    interstroke_data_ischaemic <<- is_subset(interstroke_data,         fstrktype == "Ischemic")    interstroke_modelling_data_ischaemic <- is_logistic_regression(interstroke_data = interstroke_data_ischaemic,         regression_type = regression_type, models = c(model)) %>%         dplyr::mutate(model = "Ischaemic")    interstroke_data_ich <<- is_subset(interstroke_data, fstrktype ==         "ICH")    interstroke_modelling_data_ich <- is_logistic_regression(interstroke_data = interstroke_data_ich,         regression_type = regression_type, models = c(model)) %>%         dplyr::mutate(model = "ICH")} else {    stop("regression type must be either unconditional or conditional")}: argument is of length zero
